alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pinal County; South Mountain, Ahwatukee; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued January 22 at 12:56AM MST until January 22 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Temperatures in the lower 30s expected. * WHERE...South Mountain/Ahwatukee, Southeast Valley/Queen Creek and Northwest Pinal County. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 9 AM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Temperatures cold enough to damage sensitive crops and landscaping plants and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Pinal County; South Mountain, Ahwatukee; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek
